meanings.definition: To assume a particular attitude or pose, especially for effect.
meanings.sent1: She postured confidently before giving her speech.
meanings.sent2: The politician postured for the cameras during the rally.
meanings.sent3: The cat postured as if it were a lion, trying to scare off the birds.
meanings.sent4: The actor postured dramatically on stage, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: The superhero postured heroically before saving the day.

meanings.definition: To behave in a way that is intended to impress or mislead others.
meanings.sent1: He postured as a wealthy businessman to gain trust.
meanings.sent2: The con artist postured as a police officer to trick the victim.
meanings.sent3: The child postured as a magician, trying to impress his friends with a card trick.
meanings.sent4: The spy postured as a tourist, blending in seamlessly with the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The student postured as a genius, hoping to get a better grade.

meanings.definition: The way in which someone holds their body when standing or sitting.
meanings.sent1: Her elegant posture made her stand out in the ballet class.
meanings.sent2: The soldier's posture was straight and disciplined during the inspection.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's posture waddling on the ice made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The tree's posture in the wind resembled a dancer swaying gracefully.
meanings.sent5: The yoga instructor emphasized the importance of good posture for a healthy back.
